comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: As a novice otherwise known as a "Maiden" despite my gender, I used to row in the 60's with blades like that.  Since then they have been transformed and today the blades are very different from those.  Lovely photograph of fine looking young ladies and a wonderful explanation of the circumstances,  well done ANMM.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: Thanks folks! A great set of images from the formative years of women's rowing in Australia.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article48204183 Looks like at least two of this crowd appear in this 1933 WW article...not necesarily same place/date though. Aspiring athletes should note the WW's dietary advice! nla.gov.au/nla.news-article17069059 - a SMH item on the 1934 NSW women's fours...which included Esme Riley from the YWCA club...it's difficult to tell from the SMH pics whether she might be one of these girls...but just going on the crews listed below (she figures in all of them) I'd say she probably is... Trixie Forest is listed in the following YWCA fours...there might have been other combinations of course, but my hunch is we're maybe looking at 1931-1933...the 1930 lightweight four were juniors...these girls look like seniors. nla.gov.au/nla.news-article16732642 1930 YWCA lightweight junior women's fours: H. Ray (bow), P. Hay (2), E. Riley (3), T. Forest (stroke) nla.gov.au/nla.news-article16760473 1931 YWCA lightweight senior women's fours : T. Riley (bow), P. Hay (2), E. Riley (3), T. Forest (stroke), J. Eddie (Cox), A.C. Kayser (coach) nla.gov.au/nla.news-article16926786 1932 YWCA lightweight senior women's fours: E.Riley (bow), T. Forest (2), E. O'Sullivan (3), T. Riley (stroke), A. Eddie (cox) nla.gov.au/nla.news-article16984861 1933 YWCA lightweight senior fours: E. Riley (bow), T. Forest (2), E. O'Sullivan (3), T. Riley (stroke)

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] It is funny you should come back to these images Quasymody - I have been doing some research on dear Trixie. We have a photo album of hers on display in the museum and hey presto! It is open to the photo that appears in the 1933 AWW article so it is her crew! When I get the chance to view the album in depth I will let you know the names, it appears that each pic has info on the back just hard to get to currently... Thanks so much for the articles, locking them away into our catalogue :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn6194414 ; nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn6194416 ; nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn6194411 ; nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn6194415 ; nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn6194412 ; nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn6194413 nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn6194410 going on the 1934 SMH article above, I'd say these pics involve the 1934 NSW women's fours...links parked here for possible future reference...and for general interest (!)

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] These are great! I am sure that in image vn6194415 thats one of the Riley sisters on the right probably Esme - (one of the Riley girls appears centre of our photo too). Gorgeous photo of the four girls carrying their coach!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
